ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a course that focuses on the legal aftermath of the Holocaust. The subject was very interesting and the professor was good. I'd recommend it to another student.
This course was an interesting angle on the Holocaust. I'd recommend it to another student.
Yes, but unfortunately H. Rousso is a visiting prof only.

i would highly recommend French 925. To take a course with such an illustrious visiting professor is one of the true blessings of being at Yale and he brings an expertise that nobody else has. The class starts from the beginning and covers myriad issues.
I would highly recommend this class to anyone.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: While this class is not in my area of expertise, I was interested in his approach. I learned a bit about legal history and how, as a cultural studies person, I can deal with legal history, particularly with media surrounding an important trial.
This course is outside of my research interests. But it did help me understand an issue that is close to my personal interests.
